content: shawl season coffee sleeve by jennifer dickinson about the pattern shawl season is more than just a pretty sleeve the button closure makes it a piece of cake to cozy up your coffee finished size fits standard take-away coffee cup 6 5cm 2 ½ in across the base 11cm 4 ¼ in high difficulty easy/medium hook 4mm/us6 yarn 40-45m /44-50 yds dk or worsted weight yarn additional materials yarn needle a cup a button stitch markers safety pins yarn scraps and paper clips all make good stitch markers abbreviations american terms chain chain double_crochet double_crochet 2dc double_crochet twice into the same stitch half_double_crochet half_double_crochet 2hdc half_double_crochet twice into the same stitch hdcblo half_double_crochet in the back loops only single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch st stitch rs right side ws wrong side instructions base make a magic loop or a basic slip knot round 1 chain 3 counts as a st double_crochet into loop 11 times pull the tail to tighten magic loop slip_stitch to top of ch3 count the stitches there should be 12 round 2 chain 3 counts as a st double_crochet into same stitch as the chains 2dc 11 times slip_stitch into top of ch3 count 24 please note starting chains do not count as stitches for the rest of the project round 3 chain 1 single_crochet into the same stitch as the starting chain place a stitch marker in the single_crochet then single_crochet into each double_crochet for the rest of the round slip_stitch into first single_crochet remove stitch marker count 24 round 4 rs chain 1 hdcblo in the same stitch place marker in the hdcblo then hdcblo in each st around slip_stitch into the first stitch remove stitch marker count 24 turn round 5 ws chain 1 half_double_crochet place marker in the first stitch half_double_crochet around slip_stitch into first stitch remove stitch marker count 24 turn test try the base onto the cup the hdcblo ridge should be at the transition from base to side the whole thing should be about as snug as a sock if it is too loose try again with a smaller hook if it is to tight try a bigger one if it fits secure the magic loop with a knot and continue sleeve round 6 rs chain 2 2hdc in same stitch place marker in the first half_double_crochet half_double_crochet all the way around 2hdc in same stitch as the ch2 do not slip_stitch to the beginning of the round count 27 turn round 7 ws chain 2 2hdc in same stitch place stitch marker in first half_double_crochet half_double_crochet to end of row 2hdc in last stitch count 29 turn round 8 rs chain 2 half_double_crochet move stitch marker from round 6 to first stitch of this round half_double_crochet to end 2hdc in last st count 30 turn round 9 ws repeat row 7 32 round 10 rs repeat row 8 33 round 11 ws repeat row 7 35 round 12 rs repeat row 8 36 round 13 ws repeat row 7
